search-1.title: How to customize minishell prompt?
search-1.content: You can customize the minishell prompt by modifying the PS1 environment variable in your shell configuration file, such as ~/.bashrc or ~/.bash_profile. The PS1 variable controls the appearance of the prompt in the terminal. You can set it to any desired value using escape sequences and special variables.

search-1.title: Recommended resources for learning minishell
search-1.content:
Here are some recommended resources for learning minishell:

1. Official minishell documentation: The official documentation provides a comprehensive guide on minishell's features, usage, and configuration options.

2. Online tutorials and guides: Many online tutorials and guides are available that walk you through the process of using and customizing minishell step by step.

3. Community forums and discussions: Joining minishell-related forums and discussions can help you learn from experienced users and get answers to your specific questions.

4. Practice and experimentation: The best way to learn minishell is by practicing and experimenting on your own. Try out different commands, explore its features, and experiment with customizations to gain hands-on experience.
